wikipedia_page.main: Haydon William Hare FRCO (2 July 1869 – 22 April 1944) was a composer and organist based in Great Yarmouth.

response: *Haydon Hare, F.R.C.O., 1895Dictionary of Organs and Organists. First Edition. 1912, p.284 – 1937Who's Who in Music. Shaw Publishing. 1937 – 1944 (formerly organist of Bourne Abbey Church)
*1885–1895: Haydon HareStamford Mercury, Friday 1 February 1895 (afterwards organist of St Nicholas' Church, Great Yarmouth)

The earlier church organ was given to Lady Bay church in 1903.  A new 3 manual organ by Compton and Musson was installed in 1903. The opening recital was given on 12 November 1903 by Haydon Hare, organist of Great Yarmouth Parish Church. A specification of the organ can be found on the National Pipe Organ Register.
